awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: The Method of Induced Hyperbolicity  for One-Dimensional Maps and Two-Dimensional Diffeomorphisms
awd_abstract_narration: Using the method of induced hyperbolicity developed earlier                by the principal investigator, families of nonlinear dynamical                  systems will be studied.  Of particular interest will be their                  stochastic behavior.  One-parameter families of diffeomorphisms                 close to the unstable manifold of the Feigenbaum fixed point will               be inspected.  And Sullivan's approach will be used to                          investigate when topological conjugacy implies quasiconformal                   conjugacy for maps with absolutely continuous invariant measures.                    An invariant measure of a dynamical system is positive on                  invariant sets of the system which attract or repel.  The                       principal investigator will study such systems which are close in               some parameter space to the Feigenbaum limit.  This limit of                    period-doubling bifurcations has raised intense interest from                   investigators in a wide variety of physical and biological                      sciences.  Just past this limit lies the onset of chaos.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
